project.name: sdfsdf
project.description: Build a simple todo list application platform for personal task management serving 100+ active users. Key features: create tasks, mark complete, organize by categories, due dates, priority levels, search and filter. Scale to small team usage with real-time sync and ensure basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

lld.name: Task Manager - Low Level Design

bottlenecks: Frequent queries on the 'tasks' table may cause a bottleneck, especially when retrieving tasks for multiple users or categories.
Authentication endpoints may become a bottleneck during high-traffic periods, slowing down the system.
securityIssues: Potential SQL injection vulnerability in the 'tasks' and 'categories' endpoints if user input is not properly sanitized.
Insecure data transmission between the client and server if HTTPS is not implemented for all API endpoints.
cachingOpportunities: Caching frequently accessed task lists, such as 'all tasks' or 'tasks by category', to reduce database queries.
Caching user settings to minimize database queries for frequently accessed user data.
transformationPoints: Data transformation from database tables to API response formats, such as converting task timestamps to user-friendly formats.
Data transformation from user input to database-compatible formats, such as converting tag names to IDs.
highTrafficEndpoints: Tasks endpoint for retrieving all tasks

relationships.description: A user can have multiple tasks assigned to them.
A category can have multiple tasks associated with it.
A task can have multiple tags associated with it.
A user can have multiple audit logs associated with their actions.
A user can have multiple permissions assigned to them.

indexRecommendations.reason: Frequent filtering and joining on these columns can benefit from a composite index.
Frequent filtering and joining on these columns can benefit from a composite index.
Frequent filtering and sorting on these columns can benefit from a composite index.

normalizationIssues.issue: Redundant data in the 'tasks' table, such as user name or category name, which can be retrieved from the 'users' and 'categories' tables respectively.
normalizationIssues.suggestion: Remove redundant data from the 'tasks' table and use joins to retrieve the required information.

normalizationIssues.issue: Lack of a separate 'tags' table, which can lead to data inconsistencies and difficulties in managing tags.
normalizationIssues.suggestion: Create a separate 'tags' table and establish a many-to-many relationship between 'tasks' and 'tags' using the 'task_tags' table.

performanceWarnings: Frequent inserts, updates, or deletes in the 'tasks' table can lead to performance issues due to the high number of fields and indexes.
The 'audit_logs' table can grow rapidly, leading to performance issues if not properly maintained or archived.
Inadequate indexing or poor query optimization can lead to slow query performance, especially for complex queries involving multiple joins and filters.

endpoints.description: Get task by ID - GET /api/v1/tasks/:id (Auth Required)
Get category by ID - GET /api/v1/categories/:id (Auth Required)
Get tag by ID - GET /api/v1/tags/:id (Auth Required)

restIssues: /api/v1/auth/login and /api/v1/auth/register should be POST /api/v1/auth/token and POST /api/v1/auth/users respectively, to better follow REST principles.
/api/v1/tasks/:id, /api/v1/categories/:id, and /api/v1/tags/:id should consider using a more descriptive path, like /api/v1/tasks/{taskId}, to improve readability.
securityRecommendations: /api/v1/auth/login and /api/v1/auth/register should implement rate limiting and IP blocking to prevent brute-force attacks.
All endpoints under /api/v1/tasks, /api/v1/categories, and /api/v1/tags should validate user input and implement proper authorization checks to prevent unauthorized access and data tampering.
missingEndpoints: GET /api/v1/tasks/:id/details to retrieve additional task details.
GET /api/v1/categories/:id/tasks to retrieve tasks associated with a category.
GET /api/v1/tags/:id/tasks to retrieve tasks associated with a tag.
POST /api/v1/tasks/:id/assign to assign a task to a user.
POST /api/v1/tasks/:id/comments to add a comment to a task.
aiInsights.rateLimiting: Endpoints like /api/v1/auth/login, /api/v1/auth/register, and /api/v1/tasks should have rate limiting implemented to prevent abuse and denial-of-service attacks.
aiInsights.versioning: The current versioning strategy uses a URI-based approach, with 'v1' being the version number. This approach can be effective, but it may lead to tight coupling between the API version and the URI. Consider using a header-based or query parameter-based versioning strategy as an alternative.

decisions.title: Database Selection
decisions.description: Choose the best database solution for storing task data, user information, and task metadata with strong ACID compliance and query performance

recommendations.name: PostgreSQL
recommendations.description: Advanced open-source relational database with excellent ACID compliance, rich feature set including JSON support, full-text search, and extensibility through custom functions and extensions
pros: Rich feature set with JSON and JSONB support
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to MySQL

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: Amazon Aurora
recommendations.description: Cloud-native relational database with MySQL and PostgreSQL compatibility, offering 5x performance improvement with automated backups, auto-scaling storage, and multi-AZ deployments

pricing.details: Pay for compute, storage, and I/O separately. Costs scale with usage.

recommendations.name: MongoDB
recommendations.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schema design, horizontal scaling capabilities, and rich query language for handling unstructured data

pricing.details: Community edition free, Enterprise features and Atlas managed service paid

decisions.reasoning: PostgreSQL is recommended for its strong ACID compliance ensuring data integrity for transactions, excellent support for complex queries needed for task management, and JSON support for flexible task attributes. The open-source nature keeps costs low while providing enterprise-grade features. Strong community support and extensive documentation reduce development risk.

decisions.title: Cloud Infrastructure Selection
decisions.description: Select the cloud platform that will host the entire application infrastructure, providing compute, storage, networking, and managed services

recommendations.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
recommendations.description: Leading cloud platform with the most comprehensive service portfolio including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and 200+ services for building scalable applications
pros: Largest service portfolio in the industry
cons: Complex pricing can be difficult to predict

pricing.details: Pay-as-you-go for most services, reserved instances available for cost savings

recommendations.name: Google Cloud Platform
recommendations.description: Google's cloud platform with strong AI/ML capabilities, competitive pricing, and excellent Kubernetes support through GKE

pricing.details: Generally 20-30% cheaper than AWS for compute and storage with sustained use discounts

decisions.reasoning: AWS is recommended as the cloud provider due to its comprehensive service portfolio that can support all components of the task management platform, mature ecosystem with proven reliability at scale, and strong marketplace for third-party integrations. While pricing is complex, the extensive documentation and large community make it easier to optimize costs. The global presence ensures low latency for customers worldwide.

decisions.title: API Gateway Selection
decisions.description: Choose the API gateway solution for managing and securing API traffic, including authentication, rate limiting, and caching

recommendations.name: AWS API Gateway
recommendations.description: Fully managed API gateway service that makes it easy for developers to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs at any scale
pros: Fully managed service with low maintenance
Support for RESTful APIs and WebSocket APIs
Integration with AWS services like Lambda and S3
Security features like authentication and rate limiting

pricing.details: Pay for API calls, data transfer, and caching. Costs scale with usage.

recommendations.name: Kong
recommendations.description: Open-source API gateway and service mesh platform that provides a scalable and secure way to manage APIs
pros: Support for multiple protocols and plugins

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features available

decisions.reasoning: AWS API Gateway is recommended for its fully managed service with low maintenance, support for RESTful APIs and WebSocket APIs, and integration with AWS services like Lambda and S3. The security features like authentication and rate limiting are also a plus. While pricing is complex, the extensive documentation and large community make it easier to optimize costs.

decisions.title: CI/CD Pipeline Selection
decisions.description: Choose the continuous integration and deployment platform for automating build, test, and deployment workflows

recommendations.name: GitHub Actions
recommendations.description: Integrated CI/CD platform built into GitHub with workflow automation, rich marketplace of actions, and seamless integration with repositories
cons: Pricing for private repos can add up

pricing.details: Free for public repos, pay-per-use for private repos (2,000 free minutes/month)

recommendations.name: GitLab CI/CD
recommendations.description: Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, security scanning, container registry, and comprehensive deployment capabilities

pricing.details: Free tier available, paid plans for advanced features (400 CI/CD minutes free)

decisions.reasoning: GitHub Actions is recommended for its seamless integration with GitHub repositories, ease of setup with YAML-based workflows, and rich marketplace of pre-built actions. The low complexity and excellent documentation enable rapid implementation. Free tier for private repos provides cost-effective starting point, and the platform scales well as the project grows.

decisions.title: Cache Layer Selection
decisions.description: Choose the cache solution for storing frequently accessed data to improve application performance

recommendations.name: Redis
recommendations.description: In-memory data store that can be used as a database, message broker, or cache layer, known for high performance and low latency

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features available

decisions.reasoning: Redis is recommended for its high performance and low latency, support for multiple data structures, and pub/sub messaging model. The open-source nature and extensive community support make it a cost-effective and reliable choice for caching.

technical: PostgreSQL requires careful query optimization to maintain performance at scale
Complex AWS service integration may require specialized expertise
Database migration complexity if switching from development to production database
operational: AWS vendor lock-in makes it difficult to migrate to other cloud providers
Team needs training on AWS services and best practices
CI/CD pipeline maintenance requires ongoing attention
financial: AWS costs can increase rapidly with traffic growth without proper monitoring
Database storage costs will scale with data volume
Need to implement cost monitoring and alerts to prevent budget overruns

databaseRecommendations.name: PostgreSQL
reasons: support for advanced indexing for efficient search and filter
pros: robust support for data types and operators
excellent support for concurrent access and locking
cons: may require additional configuration for real-time sync
can be resource-intensive for very large datasets
whyForUseCase: supports efficient storage and retrieval of task data
provides robust support for user authentication and permissions

databaseRecommendations.name: MySQL
reasons: support for advanced indexing and caching
databaseRecommendations.bestFor: high-traffic web applications with simple to medium complexity
pros: easy to set up and manage
supports a wide range of data types and operators
excellent support for replication and clustering
cons: may not perform as well as PostgreSQL for very complex queries
can be less efficient for real-time sync
whyForUseCase: supports efficient storage and retrieval of task data
provides robust support for user authentication and permissions

databaseRecommendations.name: Redis
reasons: in-memory data storage for high performance
support for pub/sub messaging for real-time sync
databaseRecommendations.bestFor: real-time web applications with high performance requirements
pros: excellent support for high-performance data storage and retrieval
supports pub/sub messaging for real-time sync
cons: may require additional configuration for data persistence
limited support for complex queries and transactions
whyForUseCase: supports real-time sync and high-performance data storage for task management
provides a simple and efficient solution for small team usage

databaseRecommendations.name: SQLite
reasons: zero-configuration and easy to set up
databaseRecommendations.bestFor: small to medium-sized applications with simple data storage needs
pros: very low overhead and resource usage
cons: may not perform well for very large datasets or high-traffic applications
limited support for concurrent access and locking
whyForUseCase: supports efficient storage and retrieval of task data for small teams
provides a simple and easy-to-use solution for personal task management

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Microservices Architecture
smartRecommendations.description: Break down the application into smaller, independent services for tasks, categories, and authentication to improve modularity, scalability, and maintainability. Use API gateways for service communication and implement containerization using Docker for easy deployment and management.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Redis for Real-Time Sync and Caching
smartRecommendations.description: Utilize Redis as an in-memory data store to enable real-time sync across users and teams. Implement caching mechanisms to reduce database queries and improve application performance. Use Redis pub/sub messaging for real-time updates and notifications.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement JWT-Based Authentication
smartRecommendations.description: Use JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication and authorization to ensure secure and stateless authentication. Implement token-based authentication for API endpoints and use HTTPS for encrypted communication.

smartRecommendations.title: Design Database Indexing Strategy
smartRecommendations.description: Create a comprehensive indexing strategy for the database to improve query performance. Use composite indexes for frequently used query filters and implement indexing on columns used in WHERE, JOIN, and ORDER BY clauses.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Load Balancing and Auto-Scaling
smartRecommendations.description: Implement load balancing using HAProxy or NGINX to distribute incoming traffic across multiple instances. Use cloud providers' auto-scaling features to dynamically adjust instance counts based on traffic and system load.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Data Encryption and Access Control
smartRecommendations.description: Use encryption mechanisms like SSL/TLS to protect data in transit and at rest. Implement role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict access to sensitive data and features. Use secure password hashing and salting for user passwords.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Create Database Indexes
optimizationSuggestions.description: Add indexes on frequently queried columns to improve query performance significantly.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement Redis Caching
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use Redis to cache frequently accessed data and reduce database load.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Set Up Performance Monitoring
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement comprehensive monitoring to track application performance and identify bottlenecks.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Automated Database Backups
optimizationSuggestions.description: Set up automated, regular database backups to ensure data protection.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
securityRecommendations.description: Add an extra layer of security by requiring users to provide a second form of verification, such as a code sent to their phone or a biometric scan, in addition to their password. This will significantly reduce the risk of unauthorized access to user accounts.

securityRecommendations.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data
securityRecommendations.description: Use a secure encryption algorithm, such as AES-256, to protect sensitive user data, including passwords, task descriptions, and due dates. This will ensure that even if an unauthorized party gains access to the data, they will not be able to read or exploit it.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
securityRecommendations.description: Assign roles to users, such as 'admin', 'team lead', or 'team member', and define permissions for each role. This will ensure that users can only access and modify tasks and data that they are authorized to, reducing the risk of data breaches and unauthorized changes.

securityRecommendations.title: Use Secure Password Storage
securityRecommendations.description: Use a secure password hashing algorithm, such as bcrypt or Argon2, to store user passwords. This will ensure that even if an unauthorized party gains access to the password database, they will not be able to obtain the original passwords.

securityRecommendations.title: Monitor and Log Security-Related Events
securityRecommendations.description: Implement logging and monitoring to track security-related events, such as login attempts, task modifications, and data access. This will help detect and respond to potential security incidents in a timely manner.

securityRecommendations.title: Use HTTPS and TLS to Secure Data in Transit
securityRecommendations.description: Use HTTPS and TLS to encrypt data in transit between the client and server. This will ensure that even if an unauthorized party intercepts the data, they will not be able to read or exploit it.

indexingPriority.reason: Frequent search, filter, and update operations on tasks
Frequent retrieval of categories for task organization

performanceMetrics.label: Expected QPS
performanceMetrics.description: Queries per second estimate for a small team usage
